author: jasnycmua
text: 'Tried frist time really like food environment and staff awesome\nI alway go place reading reviews but when I was going in little bit scared trying first time Bcz I saw so many negative reviews but I enjoyed my dinner\nTry once'

author: Shima
text: "I really like the food at this place
column5: it's the best Thai food around here
column6: but the service is not very good. They are slow and not accurate. Today we asked for spring rolls for our appetizer
column7: after all the food was served the lady came to our table with something else and said we are out of spring rolls but you can try these. We were like we don't want these we want spring rolls but she said you should try these instead and thinking they were complimentary because they didn't have the spring rolls we accepted it. Then when we wanted to pay for our food the lady charged us for the thing we didn't order and when I said we didn't order them she said you had them!!! I was with a friend and I didn't want to argue so I ended up paying for the stuff but that was unacceptable!\nI'm so disappointed that such a great place has such a bad service!\nI recommend this place
column8: but be careful about what you order and what you are being served!"

author: Frank Fettuccine
text: "I would say probably the worst Thai food I've had n my life. This stuff is horrible"

author: C Sund
text: 'UPDATE YOUR HOURS! If you‚Äôre closed - update google. Three different times - closed.'

author: Michelle Bivas
text: 'my boyfriend and i ordered the garee puff
column6: and pork pad see ew for delivery. the garee puff was flimsy and soft
column7: not crispy at all and the filling was just okay. the pad see ew came with chicken instead of pork
column8: and the flavor was off. the chicken pad thai straight up didn‚Äôt taste like pad thai. nothing tasted like it was supposed to and we couldnt finish even half of our meals even though we were still hungry. i never post reviews but felt obligated to post this. save your money and go elsewhere'

author: Rick Rojas
text: 'Love the food! Most authentic in the area no doubt! Since I found this place 5 years ago I just keep going back!'

author: Mariusz Bednarowicz
text: 'Bland. Very bland. So disappointed how something as simple and normlally delicious as drunken noodles can be so tasteless. I honestly regret ordering from here'

author: Mina Faraj
text: 'Amazing food

author: Marguerite Schneider
text: "I've been eating here since the restaurant opened several decades ago
column5: and it was great.  Had lunch there today and it was NOT great
column6: not even good.  We were the only occupied table
column7: in part because the restaurant looked messy and not that clean.  There was a dirty napkin in my seat
column8: which I had the waitperson remove.\n\nThey were out of chicken satay
column10: so we agreed to chicken dumplings.  They were horrible!  Clearly frozen and microwaved
column11: likely purchased in bulk.  The texture was terrible
column12: chunky in a bad way.  And some parts were soggy. MucNuggets would be better.  I complained and they were removed with no apology.\n\nThe vegetable rolls were decent
column13: the highlight of the meal.\n\nMy diet coke tasted funny.  Weird
column14: I thought.  I checked the date on the can.  It has expired in June 2020
column15: 9 months ago!  I brought this to the waitstaff
column16:
she didn't apologiz.  That she didn't provide a non-expired can was interesting.  I said that water would do.

The Massaman chicken had good flavor but the chicken was rubbery and the sauce was much too thin and inconsistent.  We left about 1/2 of it. Not much peanut flavor.

The waitstaff rushed us throughout the overly quick lunch
column17: bringing the heating up chicken while we were just starting the apps.  I told her to stop rushing us.  Rushing us in a totally empty place.\n\nThe waitstaff removed the dumplings and coke from the bill.  I think she was the only one on duty at lunch
column18: serving and heating up/microwaving.  They had a few takeout orders
column19: those people who think anything takeout is good.\n\nMaybe it was a bad day
column20: or maybe this place has really fallen.  That's a shame. I now places are cutting back on costs with reduced business due to covid
column21: but this was not a reasonable meal."

author: Cherish theday
text: 'Honest people
column5: I paid extra for my meal
column6: driver was very honest. Food is amazing. Nice big generous portions. I‚Äôll keep ordering cuz they take great care of me.'

text: 'Ok'

text: 'Good food good ambiance'

author: Alex Mz
text: 'Excellent!'

author: Samantha Pereira
text: 'Very bad food. Red curry had a very weird smell. Food poisoned the next day.'

author: Rakhi Shah
text: 'Terrible food. Terrible place. Ended up getting food poisoning next day. Stale and tasteless food.'

author: Dheeraj Chakilam
text: 'Excellent vegan options! We got the tofu appetizer and Ruammit Gra-Pow. They were both delicious. The restaurant accommodates vegan requests for substitutions and takes care of dietary preferences in general. Love that.'

author: camille c
text: 'Ive been coming here since I was little and I love this place so much.'

author: Graham
text: 'Food was bland and overpriced'

author: Alberto Vmagallanes
text: 'Very disappointed!!!! Worst duck ever!!!'

author: Iana Danovich
text: 'Very friendly and delicious. They served us under the rain

author: Saloni Shah
text: 'Food was very bland/distasteful. Noodles & rice dishes lacked any flavor. Also disregarded request to substitute in tofu. Will not be ever ordering from here again.'

author: Benicio Dennis
text: 'Very neat and accessible place. They provide generous meals and for economical prices. I enjoyed the menu a lot and the staff members were super attentive and informative. Recommended.'

author: Axel Calderon
text: 'Would definitely recommend eating here. Awesome ambience

text: 'Good food'

text: 'Food was mediocre

text: 'Great green curry! Portions are generous.'

author: infinity ego6
text: 'Love u'

author: Mind Tienpasertkij
text: 'LOVE this place. I‚Äôm Thai so it‚Äôs kind of hard to find some good Thai restaurants here. The service is great! The owner is Thai as well so they were able to make the food authentic to my taste. Really make me homesick!\n\nWe ordered the Salty Garlic Soft Shell Crab
column5: Shrimp Fried Rice and Pad Woon Sen. All were amazing.'

author: Antonio Jose Marinho Barbosa
text: 'Best!'

author: Uma Pathella
text: 'I had very tasty Thai food here. Liked the veg spring rols
column5: chicken fried rice and red curry. Bes taste of all Thai restraunts I have tried so far. The ambience is not the best but I will go again.'

author: JohnPatrick Moffatt
text: 'Delicious! Spicy good!'

author: Christina Vonghrachanh
text: 'Food is overpriced for the quality. There‚Äôs absolutely no flavor to the lad na (noodles)
column5: pad Thai was very vibrant in color but again lacked flavor. We ordered the sticky rice & ice cream for dessert and the rice was just plain rice- no coconut cream. Very disappointing.'

author: Jordan Urbaczek
text: 'Love this place. Best Thai outside of NYC and Thailand
column6: personalized service (after a few times there
column7: the waitresses know what I want haha)
column9: and not too expensive. Seriously one of my favorite restaurants in Hoboken. The Bangkok Iced Tea is SO GOOD.'

author: Aniket Jain
text: 'amazing food

author: Maggie Ullrich
text: 'Quick low key thai food with all the flavor. Vegans and vegetarians rejoice they have many options and will accommodate for your request.'

author: Gjergj Tr
text: 'Went with a colleague and I liked!'

author: William Cochran
text: 'Meh.   Soup was salty.  No spring rolls.  No pork.  Iced tea was pure sweetened condensed milk.'

author: Rebecca Juras
text: "One of the best Thai places in Hoboken with reasonable prices (although that's not saying much. haha.) I love their Thai fried rice and their red and green curries. They have outdoor seating right on Washington
column5: but we've always sat inside. Great service and a nice

text: 'Good service. Average thai food. Inexpensive.'

author: Matthew C
text: 'I ordered gai orange.  It was good.  Good portion serving size.'

author: Kiki Love
text: 'Loved the noodles'

text: 'The food is okay. Could Def be better for the location'

author: Vineet Yalaka
text: 'I want to this place fr lunch.It was clean and the lady who served us was really nice.If you want to try some authentic Thai food you should definitely go to this one at Hoboken.'

text: 'First time I try frog legs wow great stuff'

text: 'Yummy!'

author: andrew seabra
text: 'Best thai food period.'

author: Kristine Du
text: "The food was decent but would say it was overpriced for the quality/portion given. Not as flavorful as other Thai places I've tried."

author: Hoi Pham
text: 'Take your time.'

author: Mimi Chicotel
text: "Came here for lunch take out
column5: horrible customer services. First they tried to sell us cold random take out food. After talking a while
column6: she allowed me to order hot food. My friend ordered a salad
column7: the lady said to her cash only because her salad is less than $10. When my friend gave her a $20 bill
column8: the mean lady said don't you have a smaller bill? I ordered food from lunch menu
column9: the mean lady charged me from the regular menu. When I asked
column10: she said next time I need to tell her. I mumbled next time I won't come again. She charged me for the smaller amount and said she would void the larger amount later. I insisted her voiding the charge in front of me
column11: she gave me a face of disgust. Food took a long time to be ready. Horrible attitude! I don't know they did it on purpose
column12: other reviewer said it has no taste but my Pad Thai requires 5 cup of water to dilute it down the saltiness. Or the ladies just don't hate us so much to add more salt to our food."

author: Mayur Banwasi
text: 'Nothing much to talk about. Below average taste.'

author: Mark R
text: 'Best Thai in Hoboken'

author: Sunil Jain
text: 'Ok food'

author: David G
text: 'Great Tom yom soup! Drunken noodles are awesome too!'

author: Ward H. Blackwell
text: 'Food is really good.  Place is a little run down.  Service is Good but not great.  One of the better Thai places in Hoboken.'

author: Wei Xin Yuan
text: 'Do not order the take out lunch where they scoop from trays of ready-made food.\n\nI ordered the lunch that included rice and choice of 2 entrees
column5: scooped from ready-made food trays. I got the fish (salty) and pork (salty) and fried rice. The food was at best take-out restaurant quality
column6: definitely not worth the $7+ dollars I spent on it. For that money you can get much healthier and better tasting food in the neighborhood.'

author: Emily Wong
text: "Literally the worst Thai food I've ever had. In fact minus the name
column5: nothing about this place counts as Thai food. I had the pad see ew ( drunk man noodles) and it had cabbage and broccoli....this has been a first after eating Thai food for many years. Sauce was nothing like it was suppose to be.  NEVER AGAIN."

author: WalterZip
text: 'I love this place. Food is out of this world. First place I ever tried Thai food.'

author: Damian Hernandez
text: "Good food but I can't understand why it's always so empty on the afternoon"

author: Purvin Patel
text: 'Not up to par with restaurants in this area.'

author: Jonathan Arrabito
text: 'The best thai food in Hoboken!  The restaurant is small and clean.  The staff is very nice and sweet.  And the food is delicious.  I have eaten here at least 5 times now and the quality is extremely consistent.  I happen to love spicy food and this place makes it really spicy.\n\nTry the Nua Ma Nau (Spicy Beef) with Coconut rice.  Its amazing.'

author: Caleb Gilleland
text: "Honestly
column5: some of the best Thai food I've had anywhere in the States or abroad."

author: Alex Schkrutz
text: 'good for takeout at lunch...'

author: Livi Newman
text: 'Took over and hour to deliver and they brought the wrong order.'

author: Chris Marino
text: "The best pad thai I've had in the hoboken/jersey city area.  I definitely will be returning.  My friends enjoyed their meals too."

author: Jo Dhesi (Joboken)
text: 'I NEVER write reviews bc im generally ok with whatever service is provided.  This place is garbage... they told me an hour for delivery.  I am still waiting at this very moment for my food... and its been over an hour and a half....GARBAGE'
